page.title: 20Ecology in Milton Ernest
page.content: {Milton Ernest}is a small village in a rural setting. Many of the hedgerows in the area have been removed resulting in wide open fields of hay, crops and pasture. The farmers are aware of posible harmful ecological consequences and are striving towards environmental conservation and have planted many trees. There are oak, ash, elm, beech, birch, sycamore, horsechestnut, willow, fir, conifer, yew, holly, elder, rowan, hawthorn, whitebeam and maple trees throughout the D. Block. People are very aware of conservation matters and the effects of pollution upon the environment. The A6 with its vast quantity of traffic causes a pollution problem as does the proximity of the{Royal Aeronautical {Establishment,}outside Milton Ernest on the Thurleigh Road. Little is known of this top secret establishment.
